reviewText: Transfer quality of ECHO BRIDGE 4 movie sets is quite good, although film stock is not always in the best of condition. A bargain price also makes these small collections attractive. All titles are contained on a single disc. With this tenth offering in the series, emphasis is on monsters, zombies and deadly revenge. SYNOPSES for "Horror Classics V.10"-- KING OF THE ZOMBIES-- A plane crashes on an island and its passengers take refuge at a mansion that may be inhabited by ghosts and zombies. Released in 1941, this film has a WWII subplot. Director Jean Yarbrough is best remembered for heading up several of Abbott & Costello's features, plus their TV show. LADY FRANKENSTEIN-- After his demise, the infamous doctor's daughter continues his experiments. She hopes to transplant the brain of her aging lover/assistant into the body of a powerfully-built but mentally challenged servant. Musclebound Mickey Hargitay (Jayne Mansfield's ex) has a small part as "Captain Harris." THE MONSTER MAKER-- Nicely atmospheric story of a mad scientist who innoculates his enemies with a fast-acting virus that deforms their bodies. For a victimized concert pianist, the antidote may be bought for lots of money... PLUS his beautiful daughter. Ray 'Crash' Corrigan appears in one of his uncredited man-in-the-monkey-suit parts. SISTERS OF DEATH-- A Russian Roulette sorority initiation causes the death of a pledge. Years later, the other girls are invited to a reunion, but they aren't aware their host is the dead girl's whacked out father. HORROR CLASSICS V.11 is a frightening mix of monsters and demons that are both seen and invisible. Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 viewer poll ratings found at a film resource website. (4.9) King of the Zombies (1941) - Dick Purcell/Joan Woodbury/Mantan Moreland/John Archer/Guy Usher (4.5) Lady Frankenstein (Italy-1971) - Joseph Cotten/Rosalba Neri/Paul Muller/Paul Whiteman/Mickey Hargitay (4.7) The Monster Maker (1944) - J. Carrol Naish/Ralph Morgan/Tala Birell/Wanda McKay/Glenn Strange/Ray Corrigan (4.1) Sisters of Death (1977) - Arthur Franz/Claudia Jennings/Cheri Howard/Sherry Boucher/Paul Carr/Joe E. Tata

Four movies on one disc
Horror Classics Vol. 10 - Platinum Disc ID#14319

#1: King of the Zombies - 1941 - Director: Jean Yarbrough

#2: The Monster Maker - 1944 - Director: Sam Newfield

#3: Lady Frankenstein - 1971 - Director: Ernst R. Von Theumer

#4: Sisters of Death - 1976 - Director: Joseph Mazzuca

All in all; decent picture, decent sound. Nothing special, but menus all seem to work and thats rare for cheap compilation DVD's.
These movies are available individually from amazon, so you can see actual reviews and movie details if you search for the title under DVD's.
